page.title: 06Farming near Burscough(cont)
page.content: Farm produce is sold to a variety of buyers.Carrots are processed at the farm and sold to wholesalers.Carrots are sold to various outlets including supermarket groups or to Heinz food factory near Wigan. Potatoes are bagged on the farm and sold to wholesale outlets or in years of surplus to the Potato Marketing Board or "Golden Wonder" for crisps. Winter wheat is sold to Allied Mills in Burscough for flour or animal feed. Major changes in farming include the mechanisation of farming,the loss of hedges and the increased use of chemicals.Whereas thirty to forty years ago it took six horses and six men to maintain one hundred acres it now takes three tractors and two men.
